channel.title: TravelgateX Documentation â€“ Scalars
channel.description: Recent changes in Scalars on TravelgateX Documentation

item.title: Logging: Boolean
item.description: The Boolean scalar type represents true or false. GraphQL schema definition Required by <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/operationdetailed"> OperationDetailed: </a> <span>Stats information per operation</span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/accessdata"> AccessData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/supplierdata"> SupplierData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/provider"> Provider: </a> <span>Temporary type to use only during SQL server&#39;s lifetime</span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/organizationdata"> OrganizationData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/interfaces/groupcommondata"> GroupCommonData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/memberdata"> MemberData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/roledata"> RoleData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/resourcedata"> ResourceData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/apidata"> APIData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/groupdata"> GroupData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/clientdata"> ClientData: </a> <span></span> </li>

item.title: Logging: DateTime
item.description:
The DateTime type represents DateTime values. A good example might be a transaction TimeSpan. In queries or mutations, DateTime fields have to be specified in ISO 8601 format with enclosing double quotes: “2017-10-22T13:57:31.123Z”. GraphQL schema definition Required by <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/stats"> Stats: </a> <span>The service used to access the stats of every connection that uses the HUB</span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/statsdata"> StatsData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/interfaces/node"> Node: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/access"> Access: </a> <span>An Access is a set of credentials and configuration in order to access the system of a Supplier.
[...]

item.title: Logging: DomainName
item.description: Scalar for type Domain GraphQL schema definition Required by

item.title: Logging: ID
item.description:
The ID scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID. GraphQL schema definition Required by <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/advisemessage"> AdviseMessage: </a> <span>List of advise messages.
[...]

item.title: Logging: Int
item.description: The Int scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1. GraphQL schema definition Required by <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/operationdetailed"> OperationDetailed: </a> <span>Stats information per operation</span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/supplierdata"> SupplierData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/groupdata"> GroupData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/statsinfo"> StatsInfo: </a> <span>Details of an specific error</span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/statsasset"> StatsAsset: </a> <span>Asset of an specific error</span> </li>

item.title: Logging: String
item.description:
The String scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text. GraphQL schema definition Required by <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/pageinfo"> PageInfo: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/advisemessage"> AdviseMessage: </a> <span>List of advise messages.</span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/accessdata"> AccessData: </a> <span></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/error"> Error: </a> <span>Application errors</span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/parameter"> Parameter: </a> <span>Parameters for additional information for the supplier&#39;s configuration.
[...]

item.title: Logging: URI
item.description: The URI type represents a URI values. A good example mith be an Hotel Image URL. In queries or mutations, URI fields have to be specified in RFC 3986, RFC 3987, and RFC 6570 (level 4) compliant URI string format with enclosing double quotes: “http:\www.travelgatex.com”. GraphQL schema definition Required by <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/statsasset"> StatsAsset: </a> <span>Asset of an specific error</span> </li>
